Set Up: 
- Begin by lying on your side on a mat or the floor. Ensure that your body is in a straight line, with your head, torso, hips, and legs aligned. 
Positioning: 
- Prop yourself up on your bottom elbow, keeping it directly underneath your shoulder for support. 
- Stack your legs on top of each other, keeping them straight.

Abduct: 
- Lift your top leg away from your body, focusing on using the muscles on the side of your hip (abductors) to perform the movement. 
- Keep your foot flexed and your toes pointing forward throughout the exercise. 
Hold: 
- Pause briefly at the top of the movement to fully engage your hip abductors.

Lower Down: 
- Slowly lower your top leg back down to the starting position under control, avoid completely resting it on your bottom leg to keep tension. 
Safety Considerations: 
- Keep your torso stable throughout the exercise to avoid excessive twisting or rolling. 
- Focus on using the muscles of the hip to lift the leg rather than relying on momentum or swinging.
